intro: Eurystyles auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate eurystyle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) lobes at the base. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four to five petals. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
